docTitle.titlePart:
Querying and Updating Probabilistic
Information in XML

front.div:
Abstract. We present in this paper a new model for representing probabilistic
information in a semi-structured (XML) database, based on the
use of probabilistic event variables. This work is motivated by the need
of keeping track of both confidence and lineage of the information stored
in a semi-structured warehouse. For instance, the modules of a (Hidden
Web) content warehouse may derive information concerning the se-
mantics of discovered Web services that is by nature not certain. Our
model, namely the fuzzy tree model, supports both querying (tree pattern
queries with join) and updating (transactions containing an arbitrary
set of insertions and deletions) over probabilistic tree data. We
highlight its expressive power and discuss implementation issues.
